snippet: There’s a civil way to speed up justice in minor criminal proceedings: let defendants stay home.
abstract: Op-Ed article by former public defender David Feige notes delay in processing criminal cases often creates onerous burden for those who are being judged for misdemeanor offense; contends if those charged with misdemeanor offenses were allowed to stay at home until prosecutors were ready to deal with them, it would create more civil criminal justice system.
lead_paragraph: There’s a civil way to speed up justice in minor criminal proceedings: let defendants stay home.
